result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron J. Sherman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $200 + costs = $715 (includes DNA & $10 drug diversion surcharge); APPLY $500 CASH BOND = $215; due in $50 incriments per month, beginning 6/26/15 and on the 26th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 4 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron J. Sherman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice--Final Notice
TTP slip
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 9:53 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Aaron J. Sherman in court with Attorney Francis P. Raff. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Court so finds

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered. Court confirms Its earlier finding of victim rights compliance.
Upon questioning of the Court, DA Happ indicates that there is no victim impact statement nor restitution request

Court finds that there is no restitution owing in this matter
Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $200 + costs = $715 (includes DNA & $10 drug diversion surcharge); APPLY $500 CASH BOND = $215; due in $50 incriments per month, beginning 6/26/15 and on the 26th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 4 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
0 days credit for time served
Recess: 10:16 am
from Defense Counsel re: Case will proceed to plea/sentencing
Status conference on May 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.
State has no objection to the request to reschedule the 5-12-15 hearing
Request to reschedule the 05-12-2015 hearing tentatively granted upon the Court learning of victim rights compliance
Letter from Attorney Raff re scheduling
DA half slip requesting PTC be rescheduled-note attached saying no longer needed
Status conference on May 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 29, 2015 at 09:20 am.
State's with Cover Letter
Scheduling Notice

Defendant Aaron J. Sherman in court with Attorney Francis P. Raff.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense stands mute. Plea of "not guilty" entered by the Court. Speedy trial waived by the Defense.
The Court continues the Bond. 
recess 3:20pm. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/29/15 at 9:20am  (2)  Status Conference on 5/12/15 at 10:00am (with the Co-Defendant's case)

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 7, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Amended Bond

[MK] case called at 3:08pm. 
Defendant Aaron J. Sherman in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. Mr. Sherman provides a new address: 404 N. Main Street in Jefferson WI. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
After Mr. Sherman indicates that he desires counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 

The Court continues the a $500 cash bond requirement (already posted), with added conditions: 
--no contact with the Co-Defendant Mercedes C. Guzman
--no discussion of the facts of the case with James Worsham Jr
--no presence at 1241 Talcott Street, #2 in Fort Atkinson, WI 
recess 3:11pm. 


NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 4/7/15 at 3:15pm.
Surety info

ADDRESS INFO for Aaron J. Sherman
Current: 404 N Main St, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 03-13-2015)
Prior: 404 N. Main St, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538
Duplicate original warrant returned//bond was posted and def given new court date

The Court orders issuance of a Probable Cause Warrant for Mr. Sherman, to include a provision that Mr. Sherman may be released upon posting of $500 cash bail, so long as the Bond that he signs includes a date and time for the next court appearance.

case called at 4:09pm. [MK]
Defendant Aaron J. Sherman not in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck indicates that maiing of the Criminal Complaint was returned by the US Postal Service undeliverable.
ADA Beck requests adjournment for personal service. 
The Court declines to adjourn. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court orders issuance of a Probable Cause Warrant for Mr. Sherman, to include a provision that Mr. Sherman may be released upon posting of $500 cash bail, so long as the Bond that he signs includes a date and time for the next court appearance. 
recess 4:12pm.
